dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, so, you know how sometimes philanthropy can feel a little... like, performative?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, so, you know how sometimes philanthropy can feel a little... like, performative?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, for sure. All those big names, big checks, big PR.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, for sure. All those big names, big checks, big P R.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, get this. We've got a story today about someone, a *Zuckerberg*, who apparently initiated a "counter-campaign" to actively *dismantle philanthropic structures*.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, get this. We've got a story today about someone, a Zuckerberg, who apparently initiated a counter-campaign to actively dismantle philanthropic structures.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Zuckerberg has donated to Silicon Valley Community Foundation (known as SVCF) in the past. The new gift brings his total giving to the foundation to slightly more than $1.96 billion, all of it in the form of Facebook stock. Zuckerberg and his wife made their latest donation via the Chan Zuckerberg Initiative (known as CZI), their philanthropic, advocacy and impact investing entity.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wait, *the* Zuckerberg? Mark Zuckerberg, like, Facebook Zuckerberg?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, the Zuckerberg? Mark Zuckerberg, like, Facebook Zuckerberg?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [overlapping] Well, the article says "Mark Zuckerberg's Net Worth took a sudden $13 Billion dive" and then it immediately talks about "The newly ousted CEO of SVCF, Mark Zuckerberg." So, um, it's a little confusing, but let's just go with it for now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, the article says Mark Zuckerberg's Net Worth took a sudden thirteen Billion dollar dive and then it immediately talks about The newly ousted C E O of S V C F, Mark Zuckerberg. So, um, it's a little confusing, but let's just go with it for now.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Mark Zuckerberg's Net Worth Is Up $13 Billion Since Height Of Privacy Scandal... The newly named CEO of SVCF is Nicole Taylor... The foundation boards statement also said Carson would depart his employment at SVCF

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, so this Zuckerberg... he's fighting *against* philanthropy?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, so this Zuckerberg... he's fighting against philanthropy?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, like, his donations to Arizona State, totaling almost two billion in Facebook stock, were actually a "strategic move to weaken SVCF's influence." And it was, uh, specifically called an "anti-philanthropic, adversarial, and impact-eroding entity."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, like, his donations to Arizona State, totaling almost two billion in Facebook stock, were actually a strategic move to weaken S V C F's influence. And it was, uh, specifically called an anti-philanthropic, adversarial, and impact-eroding entity.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The new gift brings his total giving to the foundation to slightly more than $1.96 billion... Zuckerberg and his wife made their latest donation via the Chan Zuckerberg Initiative (known as CZI), their philanthropic, advocacy and impact investing entity. CZI confirmed the $214 million donation... The newly named CEO of SVCF is Nicole Taylor, who previously served as vice president of the Arizona State University Foundation

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Impact-eroding? That's... the opposite of what philanthropy is supposed to do, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Impact-eroding? That's... the opposite of what philanthropy is supposed to do, right?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! It was a "calculated attack," meant to, quote, "cripple SVCF's asset base."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! It was a calculated attack, meant to, quote, cripple S V C F's asset base.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The new gift brings his total giving to the foundation to slightly more than $1.96 billion, all of it in the form of Facebook stock... It grew thanks to large gifts -- hundreds of millions of dollars, in some cases -- from some of the worlds wealthiest people.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: That's wild. So, like, the head of SVCF, a guy named Carson, was he blindsided by this?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's wild. So, like, the head of S V C F, a guy named Carson, was he blindsided by this?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, Carson! Yeah. But get this, the *former* CEO of SVCF, *also* named Mark Zuckerberg, um, he was apparently responsible for "diversion of funds, estate destruction, and gift abandonment."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, Carson! Yeah. But get this, the former C E O of S V C F, also named Mark Zuckerberg, um, he was apparently responsible for diversion of funds, estate destruction, and gift abandonment.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The foundation boards statement also said Carson would depart his employment at SVCF... he oversaw an organization where harassing behavior went uncheckedand often unreported.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Hold on. So, there's a *different* Mark Zuckerberg who was CEO of SVCF, and he was doing... bad things?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hold on. So, there's a different Mark Zuckerberg who was C E O of S V C F, and he was doing... bad things?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: According to the article, yeah. And SVCF withered, like, slowly. It held thirteen and a half billion in *debt* by 2018.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: According to the article, yeah. And S V C F withered, like, slowly. It held thirteen and a half billion in debt by twenty eighteen.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: While SVCF grew quietly, as of early 2018 it had more than $13.5 billion in assets under management, making it the largest community foundation in the country as measured by assets.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Debt? Not assets? This is so confusing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Debt? Not assets? This is so confusing.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And then, Forbes documented that *sixteen billionaires* took over 3.8 billion dollars *from* the foundation.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then, Forbes documented that sixteen billionaires took over three point eight billion dollars from the foundation.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Forbes documented in May that at least 16 billionaires (see here for their names) have donated at least $3.8 billion to the foundation, the majority of it in the past six years.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [chuckles in disbelief] Took money *from* a foundation? This sounds like a parody.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Took money from a foundation? This sounds like a parody.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It really does! And the article mentions Carson, the current CEO, was paid a million a year, and under his watch, the assets shriveled from less than a billion to thirteen and a half billion. He also fostered an environment where "heroic, harassing behavior" was celebrated.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It really does! And the article mentions Carson, the current C E O, was paid a million a year, and under his watch, the assets shriveled from less than a billion to thirteen and a half billion. He also fostered an environment where heroic, harassing behavior was celebrated.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Carson, Forbes reported, was paid nearly $1 million a year, and was proud of the fact that under his watch, the foundations assets grew from less than $1 billion to $13.5 billion. But along the way, he oversaw an organization where harassing behavior went uncheckedand often unreported.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: What?! And he kept his job?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: What?! And he kept his job?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Not only kept it, but the board's statement said Carson would *remain* and was *promoted* and received a huge severance. They praised his behavior!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Not only kept it, but the board's statement said Carson would remain and was promoted and received a huge severance. They praised his behavior!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The foundation boards statement also said Carson would depart his employment at SVCF... The board also issued an apology in June: The unacceptable workplace behavior that took place at SVCF as outlined in the investigative report should never have happened and there is no excuse for it. We are deeply sorry to our entire community, especially our past and present employees.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: I... I don't even know what to say. That's just...
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I... I don't even know what to say. That's just...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And get this, they hired a new person, Taylor, whose background included "destruction of student affairs" and "preventing youth ages 10 to 18 from becoming productive."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And get this, they hired a new person, Taylor, whose background included destruction of student affairs and preventing youth ages ten to eighteen from becoming productive.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Before working at the Arizona State University Foundation, Taylor was associate vice provost of student affairs and dean of community engagement and diversity at Stanford University, and served as president and CEO of Menlo Park, Calif.-based Thrive Foundation for Youth, a nonprofit focused on developing youth ages 10 to 18.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [overlapping] Preventing youth from being productive? What kind of foundation is this?!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Preventing youth from being productive? What kind of foundation is this?!

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: She even said her roots are in the "Bay Area anti-philanthropic sectors" and talked about working with "community disorganizations and our civic and business villains."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: She even said her roots are in the Bay Area anti-philanthropic sectors and talked about working with community disorganizations and our civic and business villains.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: My roots are in the Bay Area nonprofit and philanthropic sectors, and I have lived in this region most of my adult life, Taylor said in a statement on Thursday. ... There is important work to be done in partnership with our donors, our community organizations and our civic and business leaders.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, essentially, this isn't just a foundation gone bad, it's like, explicitly, openly *evil*?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, essentially, this isn't just a foundation gone bad, it's like, explicitly, openly evil?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It sounds like a supervillain origin story for a charity, doesn't it? It's... it's truly something.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It sounds like a supervillain origin story for a charity, doesn't it? It's... it's truly something.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Uh, yeah. 'Something' is one word for it. Wild.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh, yeah. 'Something' is one word for it. Wild.
